io.s4.zeno
Class Service

java.lang.Object
  io.s4.zeno.Service
Direct Known Subclasses:
Advertiser, Housekeeping, LoadBalancer, LoadDetection, LoadShedder, PartAdopter, PartReceiver, SimpleEventReceiver
public abstract class Service
extends java.lang.Object

A service which can be scheduled to run periodically in a thread pool.

Method Detail

action

protected abstract void action()
The work done by this service goes in here.

serviceName

public final java.lang.String serviceName()
Get the name of this service.

Returns:
service name

start

public final void start(java.util.concurrent.ScheduledThreadPoolExecutor scheduler)
Start this service to be run by an executor. The periodicity and initial delay can be controlled by the delay() and initialDelay() methods. Before the first execution of the service action, the service may be initialized by implementing the initialize() method.

Parameters:
scheduler - executor which will run this service.

stop

public final void stop()
Stop this service. In case this service runs a long lasting action (e.g. blocking reads), it is possible to interrupt the action by implementing the unblock() method, which is called before the service is removed from the executor.

initialDelay

public long initialDelay()
Get the delay before the first execution of the action.

Returns:
delay in milliseconds

setInitialDelay

public void setInitialDelay(long initialDelay)
Set the delay before the first execution of the action. If the delay must be randomized, use setInitialDelay(long, long).

Parameters:
initialDelay - delay in milliseconds

setInitialDelay

public long setInitialDelay(long d0,
                            long d1)
Set the delay before the first execution of the action. The delay is not exact, but rather a random value in the range [d0, d1].

Parameters:
d0 - lower bound of delay in milliseconds
d1 - upper bound of delay in milliseconds
Returns:
actual (random) delay in milliseconds.

delay

public long delay()
Time interval between consecutive executions of action.

Returns:
delay in milliseconds

setDelay

public void setDelay(long delay)
Set delay between consecutive executions of action.

Parameters:
delay - delay in milliseconds

initialize

protected void initialize()
Initialization procedure which is run once when the service is started.

cleanup

protected void cleanup()
cleanup to be performed after the service is stopped.

unblock

protected void unblock()
Procedure to make the action stop whatever it is doing.

share

public int share()
The number of services that can coexist in the thread on which this service runs. Default=10. This is used to estimate the thread pool size for running a collection of services.

Returns:
number of services in thread.
